answers.answer: Hello,Has a fungal toe infection been ruled out in your mother’s case? A nail fungal infection may begin as a white or yellow spot under the tip of your fingernail or toenail. As the nail fungus spreads deeper into your nail, it may cause blackening of the nails. Other causes are trauma to the nails, pseudomonas infection, diabetes or vascular causes.please get these causes ruled out from her doctor.I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: My question is about my mother's feet. Down by her toes mostly they are turning a blackish color. She has had ultrasound of her veins in her legs and feet to see if she had circlation in her feet. That came back normal. She has no heart problems, But does have high blood pressure and tyhroid problems. Any suggestion on what this could be or what else can be done. Thanks
title: Feet Changing colors
